thread.title: What time is the Democratic primary debate? Live stream, TV channel, more info
thread.title_full: What time is the Democratic primary debate? Live stream, TV channel, more info

author: Ben Axelson | baxelson@syracuse.com
title: What time is the Democratic primary debate? Live stream, TV channel, more info
text:
Comments 
The Democratic presidential candidates for 2016 will take to the debate stage for the first time on Tuesday, October 13. 
Following the first two crowded Republican debates in August and September, five Democratic candidates will participate in the first Democratic debate. The candidates are: Former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, Vermont Senator Bernie Sanders, former Maryland Governor Martin O'Malley, former Virginia Senator Jim Webb, and former Rhode Island Governor Lincoln Chafee. 
An additional podium will be made available for Vice President Joe Biden, should he decide to join the race, according to CNN. 
Here's how you can tune in to watch the Democratic hopefuls face off in the first primary debate sponsored by CNN and the Nevada Democratic Party: 
Debate coverage begins at 8:30 p.m. ET. Candidates will take the stage to debate at 9:00 p.m. 
The debate will be available to stream online via CNN.com , CNNgo or CNN's app ( iPhone , iPad , Android , Windows Phone ) 
The debate will air live on CNN. In Syracuse: Time Warner Cable: 22 Verizon FiOS: 100, 600 (HD) DirecTV: 202 Dish Network: 200 New Visions: 172 
You can also listen live on Westwood One News radio stations. There are no Westwood One affiliates in the Syracuse area, but if you prefer to listen live, you can tune in to a live audio stream on CBS Radio online.
